edu.uw.cs.cse461.sp12.timingframing
Class Server.ServerInstance

java.lang.Object
  edu.uw.cs.cse461.sp12.timingframing.Server.ServerInstance
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
Enclosing class:
Server
public class Server.ServerInstance
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

A ServerInstance manages a single server socket (waiting for client connections). It can be either a predetermined rate or a negotiated rate socket. (Project 1 supports only the former.)

Author:
zahorjan

Constructor Detail

Server.ServerInstance

public Server.ServerInstance(int port,
                             boolean negotiateRate,
                             int intersymboltime)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Constructor.

Parameters:
port - Port number to be managed by this ServerInstance.
negotiateRate - true to indicate the client should negotiate a rate; false for fixed rate.
intersymboltime - Unless negotating the rate, the time between successive byte sends (in msec.).
Throws:
java.io.IOException
Method Detail

run

public void run()
Puts thread into a loop accepting incoming connections. Each connection will be sent a paced stream of data characters, after a brief handshake. Each connection is handled by a new thread, created by this method.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
